emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Smart Contracts
emerging_technologies.description: Contracts that automatically execute, enforce, and manage agreements using AI for decision-making and adaptability.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces need for intermediaries, increases efficiency but raises concerns about AI bias and legal frameworks.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Regulatory acceptance, AI reliability, and blockchain scalability

emerging_technologies.name: Decentralized AI Governance
emerging_technologies.description: A system where AI governance protocols are maintained and updated by a decentralized community.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Promotes transparency and community involvement in AI development but challenges traditional governance structures.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Community engagement, regulatory environments, and trust in decentralized systems

emerging_technologies.name: Blockchain-Verified Autonomous Decisions
emerging_technologies.description: Autonomous systems make decisions that are verifiable and auditable through blockchain.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances trust in autonomous systems but might complicate real-time operations.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Need for transparency in autonomous systems, blockchain efficiency, and security

emerging_technologies.name: Space Resource Tokenization
emerging_technologies.description: Tokenization of mined resources in space to facilitate interplanetary trade and ownership.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could lead to new economic models and space colonization but brings up issues of space law and ownership rights.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Technological readiness, legal frameworks, and economic incentives

emerging_technologies.name: Zero-Knowledge Applications
emerging_technologies.description: Applications that allow for the verification of data without revealing the data itself, enhancing privacy.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Increases data privacy and security but might complicate certain compliance requirements.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Growing concern for privacy, regulatory push for data protection, technological maturity

mainstream_technologies.name: Decentralized Energy Markets
mainstream_technologies.description: Peer-to-peer energy trading platforms enabled by blockchain technology.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widespread adoption in regions with supportive regulatory environments, particularly where renewable energy sources are prevalent.

mainstream_technologies.name: Neural Interface for Cognitive Enhancement
mainstream_technologies.description: Devices that enhance cognitive functions, with blockchain ensuring secure and ethical use.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Initially niche, now seeing broader use in education, professional training, and rehabilitation.

epoch_themes.description: A trend towards decentralization in governance, energy, and decision-making systems.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Empowers individuals and reduces dependency on central authorities, potentially increasing efficiency and innovation.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Rise in decentralized finance, autonomous transport, and community-driven governance models.

epoch_themes.description: Utilizing technology to drive sustainable practices in energy, space, and resource management.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Addresses climate change and resource depletion, fostering a circular economy.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased investment in green tech, space exploration for resources, and sustainable urban development.
